{"step_by_step_thinking": "Non-immune hydrops is characterized by an excessive accumulation of fetal fluid. According to the documents, skin oedema is a common symptom of non-immune hydrops (Document [3]). Ascites, which is the accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, is also a common symptom of non-immune hydrops (Document [13]). A large placenta is also seen in cases of non-immune hydrops (Document [27]). However, cardiomegaly, which is an enlargement of the heart, is not a common symptom of non-immune hydrops. It is more associated with cardiovascular abnormalities (Document [21]).", "answer_choice": "D. Cardiomegaly"}
